text: Very big and spacious mosque with 5 floors.....named after the iconic 1st president of Singapore, this mosques serves the Woodlands area and feels like I am in Malaysia due to the huge number of Malays in this mosque.....overall, nice mosque....

A mosque that looks magical and has that special feel to it.

Staff/volunteers managing the mosque has done a great job. Place looks creatively decorated with clear distinct features to attract audience of all levels.

Lets dive in!

Location:
Mosque looks isolated away from other hdb blocks but that is the plus point of it. It means it may not disrupt the peace of nearby residents.

Carpark:
There are lots inside but limited, same as many other mosques in Singapore. There are other vehicle owners that park along road, which is slightly risky..but hey, one is going only for a short while, it should be ok for 5mins.. but dont quote us yeah ðŸ˜….

Interior:
The ambience, colour, placements of ablution area and such were well planned. This modern looking mosque has a very high ceiling which does seem abit intriguing..

All in all, we enjoyed the peace and serenity that mosque has to offer. A great place to stop by, unwind and recharge.

Side note, i think there are some construction going on on one of the sides, so u may be affected while praying in earnest. Jz ignore that yeah.

Enjoy!

Big and spacious mosque. Easy to take ablution. Toilet is on every floor. Basement carpark has plenty of space. Donation is easy by QR code. Prayer area is huge. There's plenty of chairs for those who needed it. There's lift so it's very convenient.
Clean and very convenient near to the Woodlands Health Hospital.

One of the most peaceful and serene mosques in Singapore. Breezy due to its open concept architecture, well-lit and clean. Ample parking space at B1. Modern interior design. Seems that this mosque are fans of marine life too, as theyâ€™ve got a collection of ponds and aquariums here.
